results.title: The Newstead Swimming Pool
results.creator_credit: Csilla Csongvay, Kim Montgomery and ACMI
results.brief_description: The Newstead Pool is an important hub of this Victorian town and a community hang-out that gets very lively in the summer. It is run by more than 50 volunteers and is a place for the community to gather and socialise, and has also been known for a sneaky skinny dip.

results.title: Just one of the boys
results.creator_credit: Christina Crowley, Association Films and O D N Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Acquaintance Rape”.
Demonstrates the occurrence of sexual assaults between teenage acquaintances through an episode involving a teenage boy whose desire to be accepted as one of the boys call for participation in a gang rape. Points out various factors which contribute to the assault situation, and emphasises the need for young people to undertstand their own sexual values and those of others.

results.title: The Party game
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Acquaintance Rape”.
Dramatizes the occurrence of sexual assault between teenage acquaintances through an episode involving a teenage girl and the intimate advances of her dancing partner. Points out various factors which contribute to the dancing partner’s sexual assault, and emphasises the need for young people to understand their own sexual values and those of others.

results.title: Moving to Maldon
results.brief_description: Eric and Debra Watson came to Maldon for a long weekend, walked around and fell in love with the town. They saw a church for sale and three days later purchased it and moved from Melbourne. The town felt like home from their first visit and while they feel close enough to the city, their kids have the chance of growing up in a safe country environment where they can walk everywhere and just be kids.

results.title: End of the Road
results.creator_credit: Christina Crowley and O D N Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Acquaintance Rape”.
This film dramatises the occurrence of sexual assault between teenage acquaintances through an episode involving a teenage girl, who accepts a ride offered by an acquaintance after her car breaks down. This film points out various factors which contribute to the driver’s sexual assault, and emphasises the need for young people to understand their own sexual values and those of others. Written by Nancy Graham and Christina Crowley

results.title: The Date
results.creator_credit: Christina Crowley and O D N Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Acquaintance Rape”.
A young girl with an older boy come home after a date. They play out what they think of each other in their minds. The young man wants to go to bed with her, while she’s thinking about what a nice guy he is. She rejects him when he makes a pass at her. They argue, he slaps her and begins to harass her. The film stops there providing food for thought on the subject of sexual violence/sexual harassment.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Christina Crowley and O D N Productions

results.title: The Gervasoni Family Estate: life in the Yandoit houses
results.brief_description: Maurie Gervasoni’s grandfather settled in Newstead during the Victorian gold rush in the 1860’s and quickly designed and built a family estate. A love of music and dancing made the Yandoit houses a destination for vibrant country living. The stone house and former stables presently sit as a relic, but Maurie hopes that one day the place will be restored to its former glory.

results.title: Theatre Royal: Castlemaine
results.creator_credit: Csilla Csongvay, Kim Montgomery and ACMI
results.brief_description: A Castlemaine icon, the Theatre Royal is one of the oldest theatres in the country dating back to 1858. The owner in 2010, the projectionist, a burlesque performer and a local regular patron talk about their cinematic experiences, the history of the building, its architectural delights and how it is a major social centre for the town. Changing with the times, this is not only a single screen cinema, it offers music nights, community events, artist markets and even boasts a theatre ghost.

results.title: Building in Tolmie
results.brief_description: The Valcich’s fell in love with Tolmie, in north-eastern Victoria, the moment they saw it – 12 years on, they are still building their dream home on their block of paradise. Little by little they have assembled a unique and sustainable home using timber and stone from their land and a multitude of reclaimed materials. These gentle souls tell us a little bit about what Tolmie means to them and how they have been able to contribute to the community through the CFA and various social groups over the years.
